alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 12:26AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall that occurred on Tuesday is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1220 AM EST, Gauge reports indicated that river still continue to slowly rise. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have previously fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuppers Plains and Chester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
